brief_summary.textblock:
The double tube ETView is particularly innovative as it includes an integrated optical fiber
      to visualize the carena. This study aims to verify if if its use avoids the requirement of a
      fibreoptic bronchoscopy.

clinical_study.brief_title: Assessment of the the ETView Double-lumen Tube

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:

          -  elective thoracic surgery with anticipated use of a DLT

        Exclusion Criteria:

          -  left pneumonectomy or left lobectomy requiring an anastomosis on the left main
             bronchus

          -  proximal left bronchial lesion

          -  anatomical abnormality of the bronchial tree

          -  suspicion of difficult mask ventilation or intubation

intervention.description: Tracheal intubation is performed using a ETView Double-Lumen Tube

clinical_study.official_title: Assessment of the the ETView Double-lumen Tube

oversight_info.authority: France: Agence Nationale de Sécurité du Médicament et des produits de santé

primary_outcome.description: Rate of insertion, defined as successful placement of airway device in correct position without help of fibreoptic bronchoscopy

required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on June 04, 2014
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

secondary_outcome.description: Evaluation using a score (1 = easy to use, 2 = not so easy, 3 = difficult)
secondary_outcome.measure: Ease of use evaluated by the anesthesiologist

secondary_outcome.description: Evaluation using a score (1 = atelectatic lung, 2 = lung well isolated but not atelectatic, 3 = failure of lung isolation)

secondary_outcome.measure: Rate of misplacement occurring after patients removal from dorsal to lateral position
Rate of misplacement, occurring during surgery

secondary_outcome.description: ETView Double-Lumen Tube is not well positioned. It is withdrawn and replaced by a conventional double lumen tube
secondary_outcome.measure: Rate of requirement  to a conventional double lumen tube

clinical_study.study_design: Allocation: Non-Randomized, Endpoint Classification: Efficacy Study, Intervention Model: Single Group Assignment, Masking: Open Label
